recipe.title: Classic Lasagna
recipe.description: Layered Italian pasta with rich meat sauce and creamy béchamel

steps.descr: Make bolognese: brown beef, add tomatoes, simmer 30 minutes
steps.instructions: Make bolognese: brown beef, add tomatoes, simmer 30 minutes

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started on the bolognese. Brown that lovely beef until it's nice and golden, then add your tinned tomatoes. We'll let it simmer for a good thirty minutes to get all those flavours mingling beautifully.

steps.descr: Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, gradually whisk in milk
steps.instructions: Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, gradually whisk in milk

on_enter.say: Now, let's make that creamy béchamel. Melt the butter gently, stir in the flour, and then gradually whisk in the milk until it's smooth and velvety. You'll know it's ready when it coats the back of a spoon.
Right, let's preheat the oven to one hundred eighty degrees celsius, that's about three hundred fifty degrees fahrenheit. Perfect for getting that lasagna beautifully golden.

steps.descr: Layer: meat sauce, pasta, béchamel, repeat
steps.instructions: Layer: meat sauce, pasta, béchamel, repeat

on_enter.say: Now for the fun part, let's layer it up! Start with a bit of that rich meat sauce, then pasta, then a lovely layer of béchamel. Keep going until you've used it all up.

steps.descr: Top with remaining béchamel and all the cheese
steps.instructions: Top with remaining béchamel and all the cheese

on_enter.say: Let's finish it off with the remaining béchamel and a generous sprinkle of all that lovely cheese. This is what's going to give us that gorgeous golden top.

steps.descr: Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden and bubbling
steps.instructions: Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden and bubbling

on_enter.say: Time to pop it in the oven. We'll bake it for forty to forty-five minutes until it's beautifully golden and bubbling away. Your kitchen's going to smell amazing!
Brilliant! Now, let's let it rest for ten minutes before serving. This is really important to let all those lovely layers settle. It'll be worth the wait!

notes.text:
Make the sauces the day before for easier assembly
Don't skimp on the béchamel between layers
Cover with foil if top browns too quickly
